snippet: With Washington policy makers off for Christmas, stock trading was light, but analysts kept their eyes glued to their laptops for news.
abstract: Stock trading is light as analysts keep their eyes on budget impasse in Washington.

headline.main: Markets Quiet, Awaiting Move on Impasse
headline.print_headline: Markets Quiet, Awaiting Move On Impasse

snippet: As free third-party messaging services make the cellphone text message seem old-fashioned, Facebook is testing a pay service that allows people to send messages directly to strangers.
abstract: As free third-party messaging services make the cellphone text message seem old-fashioned, Facebook is testing a pay service that allows people to send messages directly to strangers.

headline.main: Is Paying to Message Strangers a New Texting Business?

snippet: The year is ending on a strong note for the movie industry, with the number of tickets sold increasing by more than 5 percent; Bill O'Reilly is finding great success in telling the story of the assassinations of Lincoln and Kennedy; Amazon is purg...
abstract: The year is ending on a strong note for the movie industry, with the number of tickets sold increasing by more than 5 percent; Bill O'Reilly is finding great success in telling the story of the assassinations of Lincoln and Kennedy; Amazon is purging users' book reviews that seem to betray a conflict; and more.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Hollywood's 2012 Comeback, and Reviewing Amazon's Reviews

snippet: Several companies make smartphones with bigger icons and simplified home screens designed to appeal to the nontechnical user.
abstract: Several companies make smartphones with bigger icons and simplified home screens designed to appeal to the nontechnical user.

snippet: News blackouts, though infrequently imposed, may be used to protect the safety of the ban’s subject or simply to restore the equanimity of an editor who has had enough.
abstract: News blackouts, though infrequently imposed, may be used to protect safety of ban’s subject or simply to restore the equanimity of an editor who has had enough; more often, blackout is more akin to boycott that, when made public, can be a tool for media outlets or commentators to raise level of discourse, to focus public's attention elsewhere or to glean some attention from those they are barring.

headline.main: When Media’s Decision in the Face of Events Is to Say Nothing About Them
headline.print_headline: When Media’s Decision in the Face of Events Is to Say Nothing About Them

snippet: After a Justice Department investigation into e-book price-fixing, the cost of buying an e-book was supposed to plunge, but sales of e-readers and the content for them have stalled.
abstract: Predicted e-book price war has failed to materialize; e-book prices have selectively fallen but not as broadly or drastically as anticipated after four publishers settled with Justice Dept on price-fixing charges and revised selling strategies; $10 floor for popular new novels is largely intact, but sales of e-readers and content for them have stalled.

headline.main: Little Sign of a Predicted E-Book Price War
headline.print_headline: Little Sign of a Predicted E-Book Price War

snippet: Weak PC sales this holiday season suggest the struggles of Microsoft and other companies that depend heavily on the computer business will not abate soon.
abstract: Windows 8, latest edition of Microsoft’s software, has seen disappointing sales in shaky PC market; facing stiff competition from smartphones and tablets, weak PC sales this holiday season suggest struggles of Microsoft and other companies that depend heavily on computer business will not abate soon.

headline.main: No Sales Pop for a New Version of Windows
headline.print_headline: Windows 8 Sales Disappoint in Shaky PC Market
